package.name: __Global__
package.shortDescription: The top level contains the core ActionScript classes and global functions.
package.description: this is the global scope.

package.name: C.arpa.inet
package.shortDescription: Definitions for internet operations.
package.description: Functions for manipulating numeric IP addresses.

package.name: C.assert
package.shortDescription: PARTIAL - Verify program assertion.
package.description: Defines the C preprocessor macro assert(). The macro implements an assertion, which can be used to verify assumptions made by the program and print a diagnostic message if this assumption is false.

package.name: C.conio
package.shortDescription: Console input and output.
package.description: Declares several useful library functions for performing console input and output from a program.

package.name: C.cpio
package.shortDescription: cpio archive values.
package.description: Magic numbers for the cpio archive format.

package.name: C.ctype
package.shortDescription: Character types.
package.description: C character classification is an operation provided by a group of functions in the ANSI C Standard Library for the C programming language. These functions are used to test characters for membership in a particular class of characters, such as alphabetic characters, control characters, etc. Both single-byte, and wide characters are supported.

package.name: C.dirent
package.shortDescription: Format of directory entries.
package.description: Contains constructs that facilitate directory traversing. The function is not part of the C standard, but is considered "pseudo-standard" and is usually portable between platforms.

package.name: C.errno
package.shortDescription: System error numbers.
package.description: Defines macros to report error conditions through error codes stored in a static location called errno.

package.name: C.fcntl
package.shortDescription: File control options and operations.
package.description: Contains constructs that refer to file control, e.g. opening a file, retrieving and changing the permissions of file, locking a file for edit, etc.

package.name: C.limits
package.shortDescription: Implementation-defined constants.
package.description: Defines macros and symbolic constants for various limits on resources that the implementation imposes on applications.

package.name: C.locale
package.shortDescription: PARTIAL - Localization category macros.
package.description: Defines macros and functions implementing basic localization routines and specific information.

package.name: C.math
package.shortDescription: PARTIAL - Mathematical declarations.
package.description: Contains mathematical functions and constants.

package.name: C.netdb
package.shortDescription: Definitions for network database operations.
package.description: Functions for translating protocol names and host names into numeric addresses. Searches local data as well as DNS.

package.name: C.netinet
package.shortDescription: Internet address family.
package.description: AF INET and AF INET6 address families. Widely used on the Internet, these include IP addresses and TCP and UDP port numbers.

package.name: C.signal
package.shortDescription: Signals.
package.description: Defines signal processing functions and constants.

package.name: C.spawn
package.shortDescription: Spawn, create a new process to run an executable program.
package.description: Contains functions to load and execute new child process.

package.name: C.stdio
package.shortDescription: Standard buffered input/output.
package.description: Defines macros, symbolic constants and functions for file input and output.

package.name: C.stdlib
package.shortDescription: Standard library definitions.
package.description: Defines numeric conversion functions, pseudo-random numbers generation functions, memory allocation, process control functions.

package.name: C.string
package.shortDescription: String operations.
package.description: Defines string handling functions.

package.name: C.sys.select
package.shortDescription: Select types.
package.description: Functions for examining the status of file descriptors of open input/output channels.

package.name: C.sys.socket
package.shortDescription: Berkeley sockets API.
package.description: Contains core BSD socket functions and data structures.

package.name: C.sys.stat
package.shortDescription: File information.
package.description: Contains constructs that facilitate getting information about files attributes.

package.name: C.sys.utsname
package.shortDescription: PARTIAL - System name structure.

package.name: C.sys.wait
package.shortDescription: PARTIAL - Declarations for waiting.
package.description: Status of terminated child processes.

package.name: C.time
package.shortDescription: PARTIAL - Time types.
package.description: Defines time handling functions.

package.name: C.unistd
package.shortDescription: Standard symbolic constants and types.
package.description: Here we provides access to the POSIX operating system API. We defines miscellaneous symbolic constants and types, and declares miscellaneous functions.

package.name: avmplus
package.shortDescription: The AVM+ package contains FPAPI cross platform native API.
package.description: Those are usually hidden and not-documented in the FPAPI.

package.name: avm2.intrinsics.memory
package.shortDescription: This package contains the XC API ("cross C API").
package.description: XC stands for "cross C", previously know as Alchemy, and also known as fast memory opcodes, fast mem ops, mops, etc.

package.name: flash.accessibility
package.shortDescription: ALPHA The flash.accessibility package contains classes for supporting accessibility in Flash content and applications.

package.name: flash.concurrent
package.shortDescription: BETA The flash.concurrent package contains classes for supporting concurrency in Flash platform applications.

package.name: flash.crypto
package.shortDescription: ALPHA The flash.crypto package contains a function for generating cryptographically strong random sequences.

package.name: flash.data
package.shortDescription: ALPHA The flash.data package contains classes used for working with Adobe AIR local SQL databases.

package.name: flash.desktop
package.shortDescription: ALPHA The flash.desktop package contains classes used for copy-and-paste and drag-and-drop operations, as well as the Icon class, used to define system icons used by a file. This package is only available to content running in Adobe AIR.

package.name: flash.display
package.shortDescription: ALPHA The flash.display package contains the core classes that the Flash Player uses to build visual displays.
package.description: The flash.display package contains the core classes that the Flash Player uses to build visual displays.

package.name: flash.display3D
package.shortDescription: ALPHA The flash.display3D package contains the core classes that the Flash Player uses to provide a high-performance rendering context.

package.name: flash.display3D.textures
package.shortDescription: ALPHA The flash.display3D.textures package contains the classes that the Flash Player uses to define texture objects for use in rendering.

package.name: flash.errors
package.shortDescription: The flash.error package contains error classes that are part of the Flash Player Application Programming Interface (API), rather than part of the ActionScript core language.
package.description:
The flash.error package contains error classes that are part of the Flash Player Application Programming Interface (API), rather than part of the ActionScript core language.
The ActionScript core language is the part of the language that complies with the ECMAScript standard. The Flash Player API is the part of the language that is specific to ActionScript. The flash.error package relates to Flash Player specific functionality (Flash Player API).
The error classes that are not part of the flash.error package are top level core classes that are based on the ECMAScript standard.
Note: In ActionScript 3.0, exceptions are the primary mechanism for reporting runtime errors. Error events are a secondary mechanism that are used when errors are encountered during an asynchronous operation, such as a call to the Loader.load() method.

package.name: flash.events
package.shortDescription: ALPHA The flash.events package supports the new DOM event model and includes the EventDispatcher base class.

package.name: flash.external
package.shortDescription: ALPHA The flash.external package contains the ExternalInterface class which can be used to communicate with the Flash Player's container.

package.name: flash.filesystem
package.shortDescription: ALPHA The flash.filesystem package contains classes used in accessing the filesystem. This package is only available to content running in Adobe AIR.

package.name: flash.filters
package.shortDescription: ALPHA The flash.filters package contains classes for bitmap filter effects.

package.name: flash.geom
package.shortDescription: The flash.geom package contains geometry classes, such as points, rectangles and transformation matrixes, to support the BitmapData class and the bitmap caching feature.

package.name: flash.globalization
package.shortDescription: ALPHA The classes in the flash.globalization package provide language- and region- or country- specific functionality for string comparison and sorting, conversion of strings to upper and lower case, formatting of dates, times, numbers and currencies, and parsing of numbers and currencies.

package.name: flash.html
package.shortDescription: ALPHA The flash.html package contains classes used for including HTML content in an AIR application. This package is only available to content running in Adobe AIR.

package.name: flash.media
package.shortDescription: ALPHA The flash.media package contains classes for working with multimedia assets such as sound and video.

package.name: flash.net
package.shortDescription: ALPHA The flash.net package contains classes for sending and receiving over a network.

package.name: flash.net.dns
package.shortDescription: ALPHA The flash.net.dns package contains classes used for working with Domain Name System (DNS) resources, including Internet Protocol IP addresses.

package.name: flash.net.drm
package.shortDescription: ALPHA The flash.net.drm package contains classes for working with DRM-protected content. This package is only available to content running in the AIR runtime.

package.name: flash.notifications
package.shortDescription: ALPHA The flash.notifications package contains classes for remote notifications on mobile devices (iOS only).

package.name: flash.printing
package.shortDescription: ALPHA The flash.printing package contains classes for printing Flash-based content.

package.name: flash.profiler
package.shortDescription: ALPHA The flash.profiler package contains functions used for debugging and profiling ActionScript code.

package.name: flash.sampler
package.shortDescription: The flash.sampler package contains methods and classes for tracking procedure calls so that you can profile memory usage and optimize applications.

package.name: flash.security
package.shortDescription: ALPHA The flash.security package includes classes for validating XML signatures. This package is only available to content running in the AIR runtime.

package.name: flash.sensors
package.shortDescription: ALPHA The flash.sensors package contains classes for working mobile devices that support GPS and respond to motion.

package.name: flash.system
package.shortDescription: BETA The flash.system package contains classes for accessing system-level functionality, such as security, multilanguage content, etc.

package.name: flash.text
package.shortDescription: ALPHA The flash.text package contains classes for working with text fields, text formatting, text metrics, style sheets, and layout.

package.name: flash.text.engine
package.shortDescription: ALPHA The FTE provides low-level support for sophisticated control of text metrics, formatting, and bi-directional text. While it can be used to create and manage simple text elements, the FTE is primarily designed as a foundation for developers to create text-handling components.

package.name: flash.text.ime
package.shortDescription: ALPHA The flash.text.ime package provides support for inline editing of non-Roman text for applications that provide their own text editing facilities. This support is especially helpful for applications that implement Input Method Editors (IMEs) for use with FTE (the flash.text.engine package).

package.name: flash.ui
package.shortDescription: ALPHA The flash.ui package contains user interface classes, such as classes for interacting with the mouse and keyboard.

package.name: flash.trace
package.shortDescription: The flash.trace package contains Trace facility for dumping out method entry line number and file name information while executing.
package.description: Allows to interact directly with the AVM+ Debugger output. The Trace listener function will output every single function call occuring at runtime.

package.name: flash.utils
package.shortDescription: The flash.utils package contains utility classes, such as data structures like ByteArray.
package.description: The flash.utils package contains utility classes, such as data structures like ByteArray.

package.name: flash.xml
package.shortDescription: The flash.xml package contains Flash Player's legacy XML support, and other Flash Player-specific XML functionality.

package.name: shell
package.shortDescription: The RedTamarin Native Libraries (RNL), our own cross platform native API.
package.description: Here you can find the RedTamarin core cross platform API and other redshell-specific functionalities.

package.name: shell.async
package.shortDescription: RedTamarin asynchronous operations.
package.description: Contains all code related to event loop, async mode, etc.
